content.webTitle: Black to launch New York paper

fields.headline: Black to launch New York paper
fields.bodyText: Conrad Black is set to launch a newspaper in New York, his publishing company, Hollinger, has confirmed. The owner of the Telegraph and Chicago Sun-Times is planning to reopen the New York Sun, which folded in 1950 after more than 100 years. Black, whose newspaper publishing plans have been the subject of heavy speculation in the last month, has long held a desire to have a foothold in New York. He was hoping to keep his plans secret for some time, but news leaked out in the weekly New York Observer magazine today. In its original guise, the New York Sun was a "penny dreadful" - appealing to the working classes with lurid crime stories and pro-immigrant, pro-union views.
